events.title: Battle of Plassey
events.description: The British East India Company defeats Nawab Siraj-ud-Daulah, establishing British political and military supremacy in Bengal. This marks the beginning of British colonial rule in India.

events.title: Diwani Rights Granted
events.description: The British East India Company is granted the rights to collect revenue in Bengal, Bihar, and Orissa, cementing economic control and paving the way for further expansion.

events.title: Regulating Act Passed
events.description: British Parliament enacts the Regulating Act to control the East India Company's activities, marking the start of official British government intervention in India.

events.title: Mutiny Begins at Meerut
events.description: Indian soldiers (sepoys) revolt against British officers in Meerut over cultural and military grievances, igniting the widespread rebellion against British rule.

events.title: Siege of Delhi
events.description: Rebel forces capture Delhi and proclaim the aging Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar as their leader, symbolizing a united front against the British East India Company.

events.title: British Regain Control
events.description: British forces recapture Delhi after brutal fighting, marking the beginning of the end for the rebellion, which gradually loses steam by 1858.

events.title: End of East India Company Rule
events.description: The British government officially assumes direct control over India, dissolving the East India Company and beginning the period known as the British Raj.

events.title: Queen Victoria's Proclamation
events.description: Queen Victoria issues a proclamation promising respect for Indian traditions and fair governance, attempting to legitimize British rule after the rebellion.

events.title: Indian Councils Act
events.description: Establishment of legislative councils with limited Indian representation, sowing seeds for political awakening and future demands for self-rule.

events.title: INC Founded
events.description: The Indian National Congress is established to create a platform for Indian political dialogue, initially advocating moderate reforms within the British Empire.

events.title: Rise of Political Awareness
events.description: INC members begin pressing for more rights and involvement of Indians in governance, sowing the groundwork for mass nationalist movements.

events.title: Partition of Bengal Protest
events.description: INC leads protests against Bengal’s partition, marking a shift towards more active resistance against British policies.

events.title: Mahatma Gandhi Returns
events.description: After years in South Africa, Gandhi returns to India and begins advocating nonviolent civil disobedience as a method to challenge British rule.

events.title: Jallianwala Bagh Massacre
events.description: British troops fire on unarmed civilians in Amritsar, shocking the nation and fueling calls for complete independence.

events.title: Non-Cooperation Movement
events.description: Under Gandhi’s leadership, Indians boycott British goods and institutions, marking a mass mobilization for independence.

events.title: Salt March Begins
events.description: Gandhi leads a 240-mile march to Dandi to protest the British salt tax, inspiring nationwide acts of civil disobedience.

events.title: Nationwide Civil Disobedience
events.description: Mass protests against British laws spread across India, uniting people across regions and classes.

events.title: Gandhi-Irwin Pact
events.description: An agreement between Gandhi and the British government promising concessions in exchange for halting civil disobedience.

events.title: Quit India Resolution Passed
events.description: The Indian National Congress demands an end to British rule, calling for mass protests and civil disobedience across the country.

events.title: Mass Arrests
events.description: Thousands of leaders including Gandhi are imprisoned to suppress the movement, but widespread protests continue.

events.title: Movement's Impact
events.description: Though suppressed, the movement galvanized Indians and increased pressure on the British to leave India.

events.title: India Becomes Independent
events.description: After nearly 200 years of British rule, India gains independence, with Jawaharlal Nehru delivering his iconic 'Tryst with Destiny' speech.

events.title: Partition and Mass Migration
events.description: India is partitioned into two countries, India and Pakistan, leading to massive population displacement and communal violence.

events.title: Republic of India
events.description: India adopts its Constitution and becomes a sovereign democratic republic.

events.title: Smiling Buddha Test
events.description: India successfully conducts its first nuclear bomb test in Pokhran, marking it as a nuclear power and boosting national pride and defense capabilities.

events.title: Scientific Achievement
events.description: This test signifies India’s growing technological prowess and self-reliance in advanced defense technology.

events.title: Strategic Importance
events.description: India’s nuclear capability alters regional power dynamics and security policies.

events.title: New Economic Policy
events.description: India undertakes major economic reforms, opening up markets, reducing controls, and encouraging foreign investment to overcome a severe balance of payments crisis.

events.title: IMF Bailout
events.description: International Monetary Fund provides critical financial support contingent on reforms, marking a shift towards globalization.

events.title: Rapid Growth
events.description: India’s GDP growth accelerates, poverty declines, and the middle class expands significantly.

events.title: Chandrayaan-1 Launch
events.description: India's first lunar probe is launched, marking its entry into deep space exploration.

events.title: Water Molecules Found on Moon
events.description: Chandrayaan-1 discovers evidence of water molecules on the lunar surface, a major scientific breakthrough.

events.title: Global Recognition
events.description: India’s space capabilities gain worldwide respect, opening avenues for international collaboration.

events.title: Mars Orbiter Launch
events.description: ISRO launches Mangalyaan, India's first interplanetary mission to Mars, at a fraction of the global cost.

events.title: Mars Orbit Insertion
events.description: Mangalyaan successfully enters Mars orbit on its first attempt, making India the first Asian nation to reach Mars.

events.title: Global Acclaim
events.description: Mission receives worldwide praise for innovation, cost-efficiency, and success.

events.title: Demonetization Shock
events.description: Prime Minister Modi announces demonetization of high-value currency notes to fight corruption and promote digital transactions.

events.title: Digital Payment Surge
events.description: Huge growth in digital payments and mobile wallets transforms India’s financial landscape and promotes financial inclusion.

events.title: Broadband Expansion
events.description: Rural and urban areas see improved internet connectivity, fueling innovation and economic growth.

events.title: Nationwide Lockdown
events.description: India imposes one of the strictest lockdowns to curb the spread of COVID-19, impacting millions but slowing transmission.

events.title: World’s Largest Vaccination Drive
events.description: India launches massive COVID-19 vaccination campaign, prioritizing healthcare workers and vulnerable populations.

events.title: Vaccine Maitri — Global Aid
events.description: India shares millions of vaccine doses and medical supplies with neighboring and developing countries, demonstrating global solidarity.

title: Rise of AI and Tech Innovation

events.title: National AI Policy Launch
events.description: India unveils a comprehensive AI policy focusing on ethical AI development, innovation hubs, and skill development for a digital future.

events.title: AI Education Revolution
events.description: Widespread AI learning centers open, increasing access to cutting-edge technology education across rural and urban India.

events.title: Tech Startups Boom
events.description: India becomes a global leader in AI-powered startups, innovating in healthcare, agriculture, finance, and smart cities.

events.title: Mangalyaan-3 Launch
events.description: India launches its most advanced Mars mission, aiming to establish robotic habitat modules on the Martian surface.

events.title: Mars Base Established
events.description: India successfully deploys the first robotic research station on Mars, marking a historic milestone in interplanetary colonization.

events.title: International Space Collaboration
events.description: India leads multi-nation efforts to explore Mars and other planets, showcasing its technological and diplomatic leadership.

events.title: 100 Years of Freedom
events.description: India celebrates 100 years of independence with grand events highlighting social progress, technological advancements, and cultural unity.

events.title: India: A Global Tech Powerhouse
events.description: India ranks among the top nations for innovation, AI, green energy, and space exploration, fostering global peace and prosperity.

events.title: Inclusive Growth and Sustainability
events.description: India leads in equitable development, ensuring prosperity for all citizens while protecting the environment for future generations.
